name: Sunbrella
description: The most expensive outdoor fabric with the highest possible quality assurance. Solution-dyed acrylic fabric renowned for UV, mildew, and stain resistance.

instructions: Clean spills immediately with mild soap and water
Use a soft brush for stubborn stains

name: Olefin
description: Best available alternative to Sunbrella fabric which is the worlds leading quality outdoor fabric. Offers upto 95% of the durability and weather resistance properties as Sunbrella for a fraction of the cost. All Mint fabrics are Olefin material which is polypropylene-based fabric offering excellent moisture and stain resistance plus 2000 UV hours of protection equating to 3 years of real world usage.

cons: Almost no cons unless its important for you to have the Sunbrella brand
Can fade over time in direct sun as all fabrics will eventually

instructions: Rinse and air dry after cleaning

name: Polyester
description: The majority of the outdoor furniture cushions in the UK is made with polyester. It is a woven polyester fabric commonly used for outdoor cushions with fair durability but only in reflection to the price. If you are looking for more than 18 months of usage then upgrade to Olefin and make sure to check retailer's product specifications for what fabric is used.

cons: Prone to mildew if not dried
Fades faster in sun in as little as 12 months

instructions: Remove cushions to dry after rain
Spot treat with mildew cleaner if needed

name: Acrylic (Generic)
description: UV-stable acrylic fabric offering durability and color retention at a lower price than Sunbrella. Acrylic based fabrics are very durable however they lack character and can feel artificial unlike Olefins.
